tuv.seg: Buying a used car
Carr athláimhe a cheannach
It is often a lot cheaper to buy a second hand car (even if it is only one or two years old) as the value of a new car depreciates very quickly
Go minic bíonn sé i bhfad níos saoire carr athláimhe a cheannach (fiú amháin ceann a bhíonn bliain nó dhó d'aois) de bhrí go dtiteann an luach a bhíonn ar charr nua an-tapa ar fad
There are many different ways to buy a second hand or used car – here are the three main ways
Is iomaí bealach atá ann chun carr dara láimhe nó athláimhe a cheannach – seo a leanas na trí phríomhbhealach:
• From a garage or car dealer
• Ó gharáiste nó ó dhíoltóir cairr
• Through a small advertisement on the internet or in the papers
• Trí fhógra beag ar an idirlíon nó sna nuachtáin
From a garage or car dealer
Ó gharáiste nó ó dhíoltóir cairr

In this situation you, as a consumer, are protected by the Sale of Goods and Supply of Services Act 1980 as you are buying a car for your personal use from a person whose normal business it is to sell cars

Sa chás seo tá cosaint agatsa, mar thomhaltóir, faoin Acht um Dhíol Earraí agus Soláthar Seirbhísí 1980 de bhrí go bhfuil tú ag ceannach cairr do d’úsáid phearsanta féin ó dhuine arb é a ghnáth ghnó carranna a dhíol
As a consumer you have the same rights if you buy an item second hand as if it is new
Mar thomhaltóir tá na cearta céanna agat má cheannaíonn tú rud éigin athláimhe agus dá mbeifeá á cheannach nua
In this case if you find a fault with the car after you have bought it the dealer is the person who must set matters right
Sa chás seo má fhaigheann tú locht ar an gcarr tar éis duit é a cheannach is é an díoltóir an duine a chaithfidh rudaí a chur ina gceart
If you buy a commercial vehicle or a tractor from a dealer you may not have the same protection under the law
Má cheannaíonn tú feithicil tráchtála nó tarracóir ó dhíoltóir b'fhéidir nach mbeadh an chosaint chéanna agat faoin dlí
If you are offered an extended warranty on a used car think about the cost of the warranty versus the cost of repairs that the car is likely to need
Má thairgtear barántas sínithe duit ar charr athláimhe smaoinigh ar chostas an bharántais in aghaidh chostas na ndeisiúchán is dóigh a theastóidh ón gcarr
Sellers have responsibilities such as giving accurate and truthful answers to the questions you ask
Bíonn freagrachtaí ar dhíoltóirí, ar nós freagraí cruinne agus fíreannacha a thabhairt ar na ceisteanna a chuireann tú
Information on a seller's responsibilities in car deals is available on the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission's website
Tá faisnéis ar fhreagrachtaí díoltóirí i margaí gluaisteáin ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin an Choimisiúin um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí
Often you can find very good bargains at car auctions which are held quite frequently
Is minic go bhfaigheann duine margaí maithe ag ceant carranna a bhíonn ar siúl go minic
However, the auctioneer cannot be held responsible for any defects found after you have bought the car
Mar sin féin, tar éis an díolacháin ní bheidh an ceantálaí freagrach as aon lochtanna a aimseofar tar éis duit an carr a cheannach
Auctioneers have terms and conditions for making sales and by bidding at an auction you are signifying that you accept these terms and conditions

Bíonn téarmaí agus coinníollacha ag ceantálaithe chun díolacháin a dhéanamh agus nuair a dhéanann tú tairiscint ag ceant tá tú ag tabhairt le fios go nglacann tú leis na téarmaí agus na coinníollacha sin
Before you go into an auction ensure you know what these terms and conditions are and that you agree to them
Sula dtéann tú chuig ceant cinntigh go bhfuil a fhios agat cad iad na téarmaí agus coinníollacha sin agus go n-aontaíonn tú leo
It is important when buying at auction that you know what you are doing as there is little legal protection for the buyer of a car, or any other item, at auction
Tá sé tábhachtach nuair a bhíonn tú ag ceannach ag ceant go mbíonn fios do ghnó agat mar gur beag cosaint dlí atá ann do cheannaitheoir cairr, ná aon rud eile, ag ceant
Vehicles are often advertised by private individuals on the internet and in the ‘small ads’ section of newspapers
Is minic go bhfógraíonn daoine feithiclí ar an idirlíon agus sa roinn ‘fógraí beaga’ de nuachtáin

If you buy a car from a small advertisement or on the internet from a private individual you are generally not buying from a person whose normal business it is to sell cars (although sometimes used car dealers do advertise in this way)

Má cheannaíonn tú carr ó fhógra beag nó ar an idirlíon ó dhuine go minic bíonn tú ag ceannach ó dhuine nach é a ghnáth ghnó carranna a dhíol (cé go ndéanann díoltóirí carranna athláimhe fógraíocht mar sin uaireanta)
Again in this case you have very little legal protection if you find that the car that you have bought is faulty
Arís sa chás seo is beag cosaint dlí a bheidh agat má fhaigheann tú amach go bhfuil do charr lochtach
It is therefore important when buying from a private seller to protect yourself from unscrupulous people
Is é an t-aon cheart a bheidh agat ar shásamh ná sa chás go ndíoltar an carr le locht a chuirfeadh daoine a bheadh á tiomáint i gcontúirt
It may be worthwhile to employ the services of a trusted mechanic who may be able to advise you on the mechanical state of the car
B’fhéidir gurbh fhiú duit meicneoir a bhfuil muinín agat as a chur ag obair a d’fhéadfadh comhairle a thabhairt duit faoi staid mheicniúil an chairr
The seller is required to give you accurate and truthful information in answer to any questions that you ask
Tá ar an díoltóir faisnéis chruinn agus fhírinneach a thabhairt duit mar fhreagra ar aon cheisteanna a chuireann tú
However, a private seller does not have to provide information that is not requested
Ní gá do dhíoltóir príobháideach aon fhaisnéis a sholáthar nach n-iarrtar
If you have a grievance after buying a car you should complain to the seller first
Má bhíonn cúis ghearáin agat i ndiaidh gluaisteán a cheannach, ba cheart duit gearán a dhéanamh leis an díoltóir ar dtús
If you are not satisfied with the response you may be able to take legal action against the seller
Mura bhfuil tú sásta leis an bhfreagairt, b’fhéidir go mbeidh tú in ann tús a chur le caingean dlí in aghaidh an díoltóra
Importing a car to Ireland
Ag allmhairiú cairr go hÉirinn
You may have found a car that you would like to buy in another country
B’fhéidir go bhfuil carr aimsithe agat ba mhaith leat a cheannach i dtír éigin eile
There are certain procedures to follow if you want to bring this car with you back to Ireland
Tá roinnt nósanna imeachta le leanúint má bhíonn tú ag iarraidh an carr sin a thabhairt ar ais go hÉirinn
You can find out more in our document on importing a car from another country
Féadfaidh tú tuilleadh eolais a fháil amach faoi charr a allmhairiú as tír eile anseo
Change of Vehicle Ownership
Athrú ar Úinéireacht Feithicle

If you sell or trade in your car you should register this change of ownership with the Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport or, if the car was originally registered on or before the 1st of January 1993 you should contact your local motor taxation office. You can read more about change of ownership of a vehicle here

Má dhíolann tú nó má dhéanann tú trádáil isteach ar do charr ba chóir duit an t-athrú sin a chlárú leis an roinn comhshaoil nó, má bhí an carr cláraithe ar an gcéad dul síos ar an 1 Eanáir 1993 nó roimhe ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le féadfaidh tú tuilleadh a léamh faoi athrú úinearacht fheithicle anseo
Since 2002 all cars over a certain age, with a few exceptions, must pass a test that ensures that cars are safe and roadworthy
Ó 2002 i leith caithfidh gach carr thar aois áirithe, le cúpla eisceacht, dul trí thástáil a chinntíonn go bhfuil carranna sábháilte agus sábháilte le dul chun bóthair
This test is called the National Car Test (NCT) and all cars over 4 years of age need to be tested, they then need to be tested every 2 years after that
Glaoitear an Tástáil Cairr Náisiúnta (NCT) air seo agus caithfear gach carr os cionn 4 bliana d’aois a thástáil, ansin caithfear iad a thástáil gach 2 bhliain ina dhiaidh sin
Cars over 10 years old are tested each year
Carranna os cionn 10 bliain d'aois a thástáil gach bliain
Ensure that any used car that you buy has passed the test and has a valid certificate to prove it
Cinntigh go mbíonn an tástáil ag aon charr athláimhe a cheannaíonn tú agus go bhfuil teastas bailí ag dul leis lena chruthú
You can read more about the NCT here
Is féidir leat níos mó eolas faoi an NCT a léamh anseo
If you are buying a used commercial vehicle, check that the vehicle has a Certificate of Roadworthiness (CRW)
Má tá feithicil tráchtála athláimhe á ceannach agat, seiceáil go bhfuil Deimhniú Ródacmhainneachta (DRA) ag an bhfeithicil
The CRW disc should be displayed on the windscreen of trucks, buses, vans and jeeps, and as close as possible to the registration plate of goods trailers
Ba cheart an diosca DRA a thaispeáint ar ghaothscáth trucailí, busanna, veaineanna agus feithiclí faoi thiomáint ceithre roth, agus a ghaire is féidir le pláta cláraithe leantóirí earraí
If a commercial vehicle does not have a CRW disc displayed, it may mean that the vehicle has not passed its annual commercial vehicle roadworthiness (CVR) test
Mura bhfuil diosca DRA ar taispeáint ag feithicil tráchtála, b’fhéidir go gciallaíonn sé nár éirigh leis an bhfeithicil gur phasáil sé a tástáil bhliantúil ródacmhainneachta feithicil tráchtála (RFT)
The CVR test history remains with the vehicle regardless of change of ownership, therefore, if the vehicle has a poor test history, you may get a CRW with a short expiry date when it is next tested

Fanann stair na tástála RFT leis an bhfeithicil gan aird ar athrú úinéireachta, ar an ábhar sin, má tá drochstair thástála ag an bhfeithicil, b’fhéidir go dtabharfar DRA duit a bhfuil dáta gearr éagtha aige go dtí go bhfuil tástáil eile le déanamh ar an bhfeithicil
You can find out when a vehicle is due its CVR test on the cvrt.ie website by selecting ‘Check my CRW’
Féadfaidh tú teacht ar bhreis faisnéise faoi cathain a bhíonn a tástáil RFT le déanamh ar fheithicil ar an láithreáin gréasáin cvrt.ie trí ‘Seiceáil mo RFT’ a roghnú
Since 11 May 2016 the current odometer reading and up to 2 prior readings from the previous test dates are printed on the Certificate of Roadworthiness that comes with the CRW disc
Ón 11 Bealtaine 2016, déantar léamh reatha an odaiméadair agus a fhad le 2 léamh roimhe sin ó na dátaí tástála a chló ar an Deimhniú Ródacmhainneachta a ghabhann leis an diosca RFT
You should request a copy of the CRW certificate from the seller to check the historic odometer readings
Ba cheart duit iarraidh ar chóip den deimhniú RFT ón díoltóir chun na léamha stairiúla odaiméadair a sheiceáil
Information on buying a used commercial vehicle is available on cvrt.ie
Tá faisnéis ar fheithicil tráchtála athláimhe a cheannach ar fáil ar cvrt.ie
Hire purchase on second hand vehicles
Fruilcheannach ar fheithiclí athláimhe
In all Hire Purchase agreements the car remains the property of the finance company and ownership of the items does not pass to the hire purchaser until the final instalment is paid
I ngach comhaontú Fruilcheannaigh, is leis an gcuideachta mhaoinithe an gluaisteán i gcónaí agus ní thugtar úinéireacht don fhruilcheannaitheoir go dtí go bhfuil an tráthchuid deiridh íoctha
If you have found a used car that you like, before you buy it ask if it was previously bought on Hire Purchase
Má aimsigh tú gluaisteán athláimhe a thaitníonn leat, sula gceannaíonn tú é, fiafraigh cé acu ar ceannaíodh nó nár ceannaíodh é roimhe seo ar Fruilcheannach
You should ensure that all Hire Purchase payments have been made on the car so the car belongs to the seller and not the finance company
Ba cheart duit a chinntiú go ndearnadh gach íocaíocht Fruilcheannaigh ar an ngluaisteán d’fhonn gur leis an díoltóir an gluaisteán, seachas leis an gcuideachta mhaoinithe
It is possible to check if the car you are intending to buy is still under a Hire Purchase agreement - this service is offered by various companies online
Is féidir a sheiceáil an bhfuil an gluaisteán a bheartaíonn tú a cheannach fós faoi chomhaontú Fruilcheannaigh – soláthraíonn cuideachtaí éagsúla ar líne an tseirbhís seo
It is also possible to check other aspects of the vehicle's history online, including taxation and NCT history and whether the car was previously written off

Is féidir, chomh maith leis sin, gnéithe eile de stair na feithicle a sheiceáil ar líne, ina measc cánachas agus stair na Tástála Náisiúnta Gluaisteán (an TNG) agus cé acu an raibh nó nach raibh an gluaisteán scriosta roimhe seo
To be able to drive the car in a public place the following is required:
Chun a bheith in ann a thiomáint an carr in áit phoiblí go bhfuil an méid seo a leanas ag teastáil:
• Legal vehicle registration plates
Plátaí clárúcháin feithiclí atá dlíthiúil
• Current motor tax disc displayed on the windscreen
Diosca mótarchánach reatha ar taispeáint ar ghaothscáth
• Current motor insurance disc displayed on the windscreen
Diosca árachais mótair reatha ar taispeáint ar ghaothscáth
• Current NCT certificate (if car is over 4 years old) displayed on the windscreen
Deimhniú reatha NCT (má tá carr níos mó ná 4 bliana d'aois) ar taispeáint ar ghaothscáth
Before you buy a used car you can check the vehicle's history online; there are a number of companies providing this service
Sula gceannaíonn tú gluaisteán athláimhe, féadfaidh tú stair na feithicle a sheiceáil ar líne; tá roinnt cuideachtaí ann a sholáthraíonn an tseirbhís seo
If you have a problem with a used car that you have bought you should, in the first instance, bring the car back to the garage or dealer who should be able to repair any problems that you have

Má bhíonn fadhb agat le gluaisteán athláimhe a cheannaigh tú, ba cheart duit, sa chéad ásc, an gluaisteán a thabhairt chuig an ngaráiste nó an déileálaí ar cheart go mbeadh sé/sí in ann aon fhadhbanna atá agat a chur ina gceart
If you have done this and are still dissatisfied you can then take your complaint further
Má rinne tú seo agus mura bhfuil tú sásta go fóill, féadfaidh tú do ghearán a ghlacadh níos faide
If the dealer is a member of the Society of Irish Motor Industry you can use their Investigation and Complaints service
Más ball de Chumann Mhótarthionscal na hÉireann (SIMI) an déileálaí, féadfaidh tú a sheirbhís Imscrúdaithe agus Ghearán a úsáid
You need to contact the SIMI within three months of the fault becoming apparent
Is gá duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an SIMI laistigh de thrí mhí i ndiaidh gur tháinig an locht chun solais
The Competition and Consumer Protection Commission will give you information on what your rights are if you buy a faulty vehicle
Soláthróidh an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí faisnéis duit faoi cén cearta atá agat má cheannaíonn tú feithicil lochtach
